summary: the asoiaf/got fandom is so fucking annoying about quotes. you see a gifset of a character with a different character’s quote...
body: the asoiaf/got fandom is so fucking annoying about quotes. you see a gifset of a character with a different character’s quote and you throw tantrums for what? how does for example making a stannis gifset with a jon snow quote detract from jon’s story? the books have already been published, what has been printed can’t be erased by a manip or moodboard. grow up please

blog.name: geekyfeminist-love
blog.title: I'm just here to geek out—quasi hiatus
blog.description: A place dedicated to geeking out about my various interests. Erudite discussion and complete silliness are both welcome. My love for Daenerys Targaryen is deep, abiding, and unconditional but retired from GoT/ASOIAF fandom.

summary: Do you have hope with Daenery's final in s8? Many people she's goong to die and basically all my hope has been crused
question: Do you have hope with Daenery's final in s8? Many people she's goong to die and basically all my hope has been crused
answer:
Hello anon!

It’s my first anon ask, tumblr rite of passage unlocked!  I also think this is my first real ask, so thank you!

For an answer, yes, I do.  I am cautiously optimistic.  Of course, I have worries too, the show has broken my heart many times before, and right after season 7 I was worried for a quite awhile, based on shit my friends said and stupid articles here and there, that Dany might die in childbirth.  Now, I feel reasonably confident that she will not die in childbirth.

Now, I don’t know what you’ve been reading or listening to, but I would say this: When someone speaks at length about how Dany is going to die, consider the source.  Is this someone who has always been prejudiced against her character?  Is this someone of a certain ship that shall remain nameless who is writing long metas on Dany’s inevitable death and how it will free the way for their ship?   Is this a writer who seems to really understand the story and it’s characters?   There’s a lot of confirmation bias and selective evidence reading in fandom.  I’m not saying people who ship Jonerys or love Dany are immune to it either, but again, Jonerys is cannon, and there is an overwhelming amount of textual evidence to support Dany as hero and Dany surviving.

For one thing,  while GRRM has said he quibbles with Tolkein, he also expresses great admiration for Tolkein and called Tolkein his model for storytelling. He’s described Daenerys as an Aragorn character.   Like Daenerys, Aragorn was descended from an ancient and noble line of monarchs, and he is similarly haunted by the sins of his ancestors. It was his ancestor Isildur who succumbed to the temptation of the ring of power and refused to destroy it, all but assuring that Sauron would rise again.  Aragorn is ever mindful of the failings of his ancestors and determined not to repeat their mistakes. What happens to Aragorn at the end of LOTR?  He is restored to his throne and ends up ruling justly.   GRRM’s already delved into the complexities of what it means to rule justly more than Tolkein ever did, so I doubt Dany’s story will exactly mirror Aragon’s, but they’re the same kind of character, which bodes well for her.

For another thing,  Dany’s whole plot arc has been about leadership, ruling, and wielding power.   She’s been learning how to rule.  She refuses to leave Essos when she realizes her errors following Astapor, and she sees how unstable the region is.  She insists that no one should trust her to lead if she leaves the people of Essos in need and stays to make things right.  She believes wholeheartedly in ending slavery and refuses to leave people behind her to languish in it.  She has numerous quotes about how monarchs exist to protect all their people, that monarchs need to listen to all people, high born and low, in the show she has that wonderful quote about breaking the wheel in which she declares her desire to change a system in which the wealthy continually struggle for power at the expense of all others.   How many other leaders and monarchs in this series spend time worrying about these things?   Daenerys and Jon are the only leaders still standing who have some kind of bigger picture in mind.  Her storyline has been grooming her as a ruler, so I’m not convinced it would be good storytelling to kill her off. 

Finally, I believe @ladyofdragonstone has posted about the show’s filming schedule, what’s available of it anyway.   Emilia was filming through the last episode, this bodes well for Dany’s survival.  Listen to all her music, how many characters have such a wealth of music written for them, of heroic music nonetheless?  They’re not just letting the composer do what he wants in utter disregard for the story arc.  The music is part of the storytelling.

If Daenerys dies, I think it will be in a heroic way, but I do think the odds of her survival are good.

summary: Is it me or anyone else see a sudden increase in Jaime/Sansa fics in AO3?
body:
Is it me or anyone else see a sudden increase in Jaime/Sansa fics in AO3?

Looks like Sansa fans realized that Jonsa is stupid and moved on. Good for Y'all but isn’t Jaime old enough to be her dad?

summary: I tried so hard and didn’t get far.  In the end I learned a lot. (liquify saves lives) And it’s all that matters.   I guess. ...
caption:
I tried so hard and didn’t get far. 
In the end I learned a lot. (liquify saves lives)
And it’s all that matters. 


I guess. 

*btw I didn’t want to go realistic at the beginning but I change my mind 9312809 times during the process… so yeah*
